I'll throw in a recipe for Varenyky.

Recipe for Potato Dumplings (Varenyky)
Ingredients:
For the dough:
Wheat flour ‚Äì 500 g
Water ‚Äì 200 ml
Egg ‚Äì 1
Salt ‚Äì 1 tsp
For the filling:
Potatoes ‚Äì 1 kg
Onions ‚Äì 2
Lard or butter ‚Äì 50 g
Salt ‚Äì to taste
Ground black pepper ‚Äì to taste
Preparation steps:
Making the dough:
Sifting the flour: Sift the flour into a large bowl.
Making the dough: Add salt and the egg to the flour. Gradually pour in the water, constantly stirring. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Resting the dough: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or cover it with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preparing the filling:
Boiling the potatoes: Peel the potatoes, cut them into large pieces, and boil until tender in salted water.
Preparing the onions: While the potatoes are boiling, finely chop the onions. Saut√© the onions in lard or butter until golden brown.
Making the potato puree: Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the saut√©ed onions, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Forming the dumplings:
Rolling out the dough: Roll out the dough into a thin sheet about 2-3 mm thick. Use a glass or cutter to cut out circles approximately 7-8 cm in diameter.
Forming the dumplings: Place a spoonful of potato filling on each circle of dough. Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges tightly to seal the dumplings.
Cooking the dumplings:
Boiling water: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt.
Cooking the dumplings: Gently drop the dumplings into the boiling water, stirring carefully to prevent sticking. Cook until done (approximately 5-7 minutes after they float to the surface).
Serving:
Removing the dumplings: Remove the dumplings with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate.
Serving: Serve the dumplings hot, optionally drizzling with melted butter, sour cream, or saut√©ed onions.
Enjoy your meal!

If I had a month to come up with the worst possible game I could to make the most money I could from gullible weebs and eastern audiences that didn't know any better or absolutely knew better and just didn't care, I would end up inventing a 1:1 replica of this game. This is seriously the most incomprehensible pay-to-win garbage I've ever seen. 30 different currencies, 50 different menus with 80 different sub-menus within them. Competitive gameplay with gacha'd characters and abilities you level up outside of matches. It's seriously the most heinous example of a terrible, pay-to-win, hell-game I could possibly think of. Even if you are a massive One Piece fan, if you have any integrity or care about your mental sanity and financial situation at all, don't even give this game a second thought. It will be EoS within a year, which the developers absolutely planned for, and it only exists to make money. Passionless, lifeless, meaningless, evil. 0/10. It's kinda fun sometimes though........................

Bounty Rush is an exhilarating 4v4 team action game set in the vibrant world of ONE PIECE. The real-time multiplayer battles are fast-paced and strategic, rewarding teamwork and clever use of items on the dynamic 3D stages. Each character feels distinct, with unique strengths that let you tailor your playstyle to offense or defense. The game captures the spirit of the anime perfectly, making every match a thrilling experience. Quick, chaotic, and incredibly fun‚ÄîBounty Rush is a must for any ONE PIECE fan.

negative.review:
As a long time One Piece fan and gacha game enjoyer, I would have to say that this game is blatantly one of the worst games I have ever played. The matchmaking decides that if you reach a certain point, all you will come up against are players 2 ranks higher than you, in pretty much every match. For such a wide character roster, only 95% of the characters aren't viable or are downright useless. It seems the only way to be competetive is to a) have been playing for years or b) spend way too much money trying to not only get the new "meta" character, but get dupes of them so you can have that character at max level. But I think the most egregious part of the game is that they keep coming up with characters that are so oppressive it just sucks the fun out of the game. Take Kizaru for example. As far as I know, he has:

1) An auto-dodge passive that avoids skills if he's at above a certain health threshold - no need to time your dodges.
2) A passive that heals him based on the damage he does, so if you got lucky to damage him in the first place, he just heals right back up.
3) A Map-wide damage skill that hits almost every single capture point. So any Defenders sitting on their points doing their job get obliterated, and Runners trying to capture flags are just straight up dead. So 1 character essentially invalidates 2 of the major roles of the game

Sure, you can counter this character with like, 1 or 2 units. But they have a 0.04% chance of being summoned on the banners they come up with.

And supposedly the game has a big hacker problem? I couldn't tell who was hacking or not, because I was trying to do objectives and getting blasted by Kizaru from across the map anyways.

While the start of the game is relatively generous and fun, and doing some of the character progression events is a nice dopamine hit, it quickly turns into a nightmare of constantly facing teams that have 70,000 combat power higher than you from other tiers, laggy servers, and broken characters that if you didn't summon them, you might as well take a break from the game for the season (or just quit). Absolutely one of the worst new player experiences I have ever had in a gacha game, that trades the good name of the One Piece series and turns it into a blatant cash-grab.

So if anyone ends up getting to the bottom of this review, just know the game is not worth your time or investment.

i play many game , thiss game the worst macthmaking ever ive play. that why i never spend money any cen no chance.

It breaks my heart to not recommend this game, but I'm left with no choice. I've waited so so long for Bounty Rush to hit Steam but there's far too many complications. When I first played it I couldn't even get passed a black screen. The servers are horrid. You can't load anything. Whenever there's updates, you can't even download said update. It stays stuck at 0% for lord knows how long before it tells you there was an error. You click okay only for it to be the same loop.

I've only managed to play one match. And that was a battle to just get to. But from playing that one battle, it was really fun. The game is visually beautiful, and has so much potential. But if you can't even load to the main menu there's zero point in playing. I straight up uninstalled and hope one day they fix whatever is going on. I promise you, it's not my internet. I have never had issues with my net. Only with this game.

That aside, it's also a huge let down that from what I noticed, there wasn't even a VS mode to fight against CPU's. You'd think they'd have something like that. Such a simple thing could make players keep playing over and over.
Your servers are absolutely dogshit kept on losing 100 ranked points per match for server error, a game made by greedy devs lol

I've played a lot of other mobile gacha's like this like Bleach Brave Souls, Hearthstone, Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes, Umemasume, and some others from Niantic and KLab etc. But this one is definitely the greediest in terms of f2p rewards and scale pacing which is unexcusable cause this game is making more money than most of those games I mentioned. They can afford to give you at least 1 maxed 6 star off the bat, people spending money/time should be because they like the game so much they want to play other characters not so they can play the game at all. Sometimes even though I'm using my best character after days of grinding I get penalized for AFK even though I am trying as hard as I can the whole time because the enemy team is so much stronger I just can't get a KO or capture a single point. The AFK system just looks at your final score it doesn't even check if you are pressing buttons or not despite there being a replay system that they could easily link to their AFK system to see who actually should count as AFK or not.

It is truly a fun game for a good amount of hours. It seemed like the game probably had balanced match making with you playing with other newbies. As well as a gacha system that didn't seem to be too imbalanced during the early hours of first starting.

But after those good hours... the game just becomes terrible. Very unbalanced and company greed rot this game. The pay to win aspect is highly annoying. Maybe I could try to play dozens more hours to get to a level that can beat those players that are paying, but to get there, I would have to struggle through dozens of hours of painful game play. And their is no balanced match making either. I could get into a game with my best character, and all my teammates will be characters no one even knows the name of, while the enemy team will be full of 5th Gear Luffy, Kizaru, and other meta characters. Truly kills the fun of the game when you get into a game where you have a 0% chance to win.

Honestly just simple balanced match making should do the trick even with company greed. The people paying will go to higher ranked matches, while those middle of the group can have fun and competitive games while grinding to a higher level.

The most unbalanced game ever! Within 4 hours of game play you will be facing players you have no chance of defeating. It's pay to win and certain characters just counter your best attacks so fighting in league is just a joke. I went from winning 14 in a row to losing 15 in a row as soon as I hit B league. The game could be so much better if they actually cared to fix it. But FTP games never get much love so RIP this game.
not great wouldent recomend graphics on max it still trash

Actually garbage. I played for a few days, less than a week. Managed to, via promotional new user "quests", to level up a couple of characters and climb into A- rank (Gold)~ The Matchmaker is SO fn bad, it will load your team up with A-, and fill the enemy team with S, A, A+; Players/Characters that can and would just one-shot you, [In my case, Luffy and Zoro, the Main Characters, equal level, current arc] from across the map (Looking at you, Borsalino, [and even Gol D.]). Not once, consistently.. 

When I first noticed this, I just stopped playing for the day. But noticing it as a pattern, and I'll be done for good. It's like, okay why? Explain it to me, devs.. Why would the Matchmaker not just balance out the teams? If there's 4 A- and 4 A+, why not just split them?: Teams of equally A+, A+, A-, A-. I'm sure it's even worse the higher it gets, A+'s getting against a full team of SS. It's truly doodoo, all around, and not worth a moment more of frustration. I understand you want the powerhouses, like Gear 5, to hit hard, but you need to care more about balance. Your game is so bad.. I honestly don't believe you deserve to use the One Piece intellectual property. Games aren't suppose to frustrate you like this. It's okay for a game to be challenging, but this... this ain't it. Lag and getting one-shot. No-lifers who have been playing on mobile for years. Forget all the Gatcha elements and the literal hundred different types of currency, and a ! quest along the entire border of the homepage.. I could get over all of that if the game at least pretended to be fair during the bread and butter gamemode. 

Seeing the post from 2024 pinned here on Steam tells me all I really need to know, that this problem has been ongoing and will continue. I can't deny, the free dopamine is honestly welcome right now, so I will give the game a single additional chance, open up my daily 1/11 chance to find a nugget of gold amongst the dung, do a match or two, but I fully expect to become frustrated again and to uninstall within the next 24h. Should I end up keeping the game, I'll likely delete this review.

Wrote me review at thee end tov dis' post-
üìú‚úç: https://thesatisfaction.weebly.com/shipsblog/one-piece-bounty-rush

[h1]  Pay or Grind Forever [/h1]
This game is only for the F2Ps (Forced to Plays) who have been grinding every day since launch, or for those with infinite money to pull every broken character that can literally one-shot you the moment you spawn.

I had fun in the lower leagues where you can at least try out the diverse One Piece cast, but the moment you (accidentally) climb to S- and above, the game becomes unbearable. Daily tasks like knocking out 3 enemies or capturing 3 flags turn into near impossibilities. You‚Äôre outclassed by whales and veterans, and there‚Äôs no way around it.

In hindsight, I should‚Äôve expected this ‚Äî a PvP gacha game will always be unfair.

As a huge One Piece fan with limited spending power, this game is nothing short of disappointing. 

[i]‚ÄúA Whale‚Äôs Playground, Not a Pirate‚Äôs Adventure‚Äù[/i]

As a long time One Piece fan and gacha game enjoyer, I would have to say that this game is blatantly one of the worst games I have ever played. The matchmaking decides that if you reach a certain point, all you will come up against are players 2 ranks higher than you, in pretty much every match. For such a wide character roster, only 95% of the characters aren't viable or are downright useless. It seems the only way to be competetive is to a) have been playing for years or b) spend way too much money trying to not only get the new "meta" character, but get dupes of them so you can have that character at max level. But I think the most egregious part of the game is that they keep coming up with characters that are so oppressive it just sucks the fun out of the game. Take Kizaru for example. As far as I know, he has:

1) An auto-dodge passive that avoids skills if he's at above a certain health threshold - no need to time your dodges.
2) A passive that heals him based on the damage he does, so if you got lucky to damage him in the first place, he just heals right back up.
3) A Map-wide damage skill that hits almost every single capture point. So any Defenders sitting on their points doing their job get obliterated, and Runners trying to capture flags are just straight up dead. So 1 character essentially invalidates 2 of the major roles of the game

Sure, you can counter this character with like, 1 or 2 units. But they have a 0.04% chance of being summoned on the banners they come up with.

And supposedly the game has a big hacker problem? I couldn't tell who was hacking or not, because I was trying to do objectives and getting blasted by Kizaru from across the map anyways.

While the start of the game is relatively generous and fun, and doing some of the character progression events is a nice dopamine hit, it quickly turns into a nightmare of constantly facing teams that have 70,000 combat power higher than you from other tiers, laggy servers, and broken characters that if you didn't summon them, you might as well take a break from the game for the season (or just quit). Absolutely one of the worst new player experiences I have ever had in a gacha game, that trades the good name of the One Piece series and turns it into a blatant cash-grab.

So if anyone ends up getting to the bottom of this review, just know the game is not worth your time or investment.

Managed to, via promotional new user "quests", to level up a couple of characters and climb into A- rank (Gold)~ The Matchmaker is SO fn bad, it will load your team up with A-, and fill the enemy team with S, A, A+; Players/Characters that can and would just one-shot you, [In my case, Luffy and Zoro, the Main Characters, equal level, current arc] from across the map (Looking at you, Borsalino, [and even Gol D.]). Not once, consistently.. 

When I first noticed this, I just stopped playing for the day. But noticing it as a pattern, and I'll be done for good. It's like, okay why? Explain it to me, devs.. Why would the Matchmaker not just balance out the teams? If there's 4 A- and 4 A+, why not just split them?: Teams of equally A+, A+, A-, A-. I'm sure it's even worse the higher it gets, A+'s getting against a full team of SS. It's truly doodoo, all around, and not worth a moment more of frustration. I understand you want the powerhouses, like Gear 5, to hit hard, but you need to care more about balance. Your game is so bad.. I honestly don't believe you deserve to use the One Piece intellectual property. Games aren't suppose to frustrate you like this. It's okay for a game to be challenging, but this... this ain't it. Lag and getting one-shot. No-lifers who have been playing on mobile for years. Forget all the Gatcha elements and the literal hundred different types of currency, and a ! quest along the entire border of the homepage.. I could get over all of that if the game at least pretended to be fair during the bread and butter gamemode. 

Seeing the post from 2024 pinned here on Steam tells me all I really need to know, that this problem has been ongoing and will continue. I can't deny, the free dopamine is honestly welcome right now, so I will give the game a single additional chance, open up my daily 1/11 chance to find a nugget of gold amongst the dung, do a match or two, but I fully expect to become frustrated again and to uninstall within the next 24h. Should I end up keeping the game, I'll likely delete this review.

And to the devs: IF you send me one more notice that you are going to ban me from playing, when I refuse to play against people on MAX Level while I am still on mid and YOU being responsible for the Play-a-bility of this game, I WILL SUE YOU.

DO NOT SPEND MONEY IN THIS GAME UNLESS YOU WANT TO SPEND THOUSANDS ON A GACHA JUST TO KEEP UP WITH THE EVER INCREASING POWER GAPS.

There will be an eventual time when this game will become unwinnable for F2P and it doesn't even take long. I thought my friend was lying when they told me about how bad the pay-to-win in this game is so I thought I'd try it for myself and find out if they were just bad at it or if they were right. THEY WERE RIGHT. 

The "matchmaking" is a joke and even from the very first hours of playing (I'm posting this originally just 4 hours in) you get utterly shut out and shut down from the way that the "matchmaking" will always favor one team over another and force a lower ranked, lesser built group against "fearsome foes" (the way the game admits that the match up is utterly unbalanced and unfair but goes ahead and puts you up against them anyway, time after time). So brand new players who are trying to decide if the game play is even worth spend money on to build their account get stomped by whale players and smurfs even as early as C and B ranks at player level 5-6. 

HOW IS THIS A GOOD PLAYER EXPERIENCE? The answer is it's NOT. I watched my friend get matched up against a team of S+ ranked players with three of the special Kizaru characters, 2 of the blue shirted Garps, and two Kuzans - all of them overboosted to 30+ with three medals each, meaning they were fully leveled to 100 - with a team total of over 200000 power and my friend who has their team power at over 47000 and is S- was matched with three other S- players with a combined team total of about 158000 power. How is this even or fair or even entertaining? It's just frustrating when you're getting shut down from rising in a rank that the other team isn't even apart of nor are they apart of the one above it. This happens so frequently to my friend (7 to 8 matches out of 10 will match my friend up with "fearsome foe" enemies) that it's not a bug; it's a feature.

And then I experienced it for myself at B rank, where I was faced with an entire group of B+ rnaked players, half of which with the brand new Luffy maxed out already. My team was full of random, not new characters, not maxed out, and some not even wearing medals (think of them as equipment which gives stat boosts) and where normally during a match a players will usually score between 2000-6000 points, we were shut down so fast and hard I had the highest score of 688. That's not fun, it's not encouraging me to play more or pay more because if that quickly I'm made to feel like nothing I can do matters, that's not a positive experience and games ARE MEANT TO BE FUN. Mind you, B rank took me only 3-ish hours to get to at player level 6 and I was playing very casually, not rushing through things. And two of those boosted and maxed out players were again against me in the very next match up.

Either the very idea of throwing together such an uneven match is the point or the developers DON'T CARE that's what happens, again and again and again and again, thus making new player experience utterly trash. And the biggest problem is that this "matchmaking" problem isn't part of a side game or event thing, it's the main mode of play and there's nothing you can do unless you can find three players who do have all the meta characters who are willing to form a team with you so you can have a regular fighting chance. And finding that is, again, very hard for new players. 

So, I guess if you want, go ahead and play but know that you will have to shell out literal thousands of dollars to catch up with the power curve if you don't want to just be fodder for whales to beat down with their bought and overboosted line-ups of the most current and most powerful characters in the game. 

And the thing is the format could be very fun - short small batch PvP matches which have very clear goals with a line up of interesting characters and powers to leverage - but the fact that the "matchmaking" is so bad I have to keep putting it in quotes because there's nothing actually matching about it ruins the experience and shuts down new players very early in, forcing them to either spend crazy amounts for very low chances of pulling the units which would actually help them to be competitive, be faced with the very really possibility that on average they will win *MAYBE* 1 in 10 matches because of how unfair and unbalanced "matchmaking" is, or give up and drop this game entirely to spare themselves the frustration of being treated like sacrifices to whale players. 

IN CONCLUSION: CANNOT RECOMMEND, VERY PREDATORY GACHA WHICH CRAPS ON NEW PLAYERS WHO DON'T SPEND RIDICULOUS AMOUNTS OF MONEY ON IT AND REFUSES TO DO ANYTHING ABOUT HOW UNBALANCED "MATCHMAKING" IS.

For fairness, will update in a few days to see if the weekend is an outlier.

I've played a lot of other mobile gacha's like this like Bleach Brave Souls, Hearthstone, Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes, Umemasume, and some others from Niantic and KLab etc. But this one is definitely the greediest in terms of f2p rewards and scale pacing which is unexcusable cause this game is making more money than most of those games I mentioned. They can afford to give you at least 1 maxed 6 star off the bat, people spending money/time should be because they like the game so much they want to play other characters not so they can play the game at all. Sometimes even though I'm using my best character after days of grinding I get penalized for AFK even though I am trying as hard as I can the whole time because the enemy team is so much stronger I just can't get a KO or capture a single point. The AFK system just looks at your final score it doesn't even check if you are pressing buttons or not despite there being a replay system that they could easily link to their AFK system to see who actually should count as AFK or not.

It is truly a fun game for a good amount of hours. It seemed like the game probably had balanced match making with you playing with other newbies. As well as a gacha system that didn't seem to be too imbalanced during the early hours of first starting.

But after those good hours... the game just becomes terrible. Very unbalanced and company greed rot this game. The pay to win aspect is highly annoying. Maybe I could try to play dozens more hours to get to a level that can beat those players that are paying, but to get there, I would have to struggle through dozens of hours of painful game play. And their is no balanced match making either. I could get into a game with my best character, and all my teammates will be characters no one even knows the name of, while the enemy team will be full of 5th Gear Luffy, Kizaru, and other meta characters. Truly kills the fun of the game when you get into a game where you have a 0% chance to win.

Honestly just simple balanced match making should do the trick even with company greed. The people paying will go to higher ranked matches, while those middle of the group can have fun and competitive games while grinding to a higher level.

EDIT: I'm just going for achievements at this point. But every hour I play, it's horrible. The play session I had before this edit, I played like 10+ matches, and every time, my team's power was about 120-130 thousand, while the enemy's team power was over 160 thousand every time, sometimes going as high as 190 thousand. Quite literally not possible to win any of those matches. Worst part is, this is bringing my rank down every time. How am I supposed to rank up if it puts me in impossible to win matches, which lead to a decrease in my rank?

üìú‚úç: https://thesatisfaction.weebly.com/shipsblog/one-piece-bounty-rush

[h1]  Pay or Grind Forever [/h1]
This game is only for the F2Ps (Forced to Plays) who have been grinding every day since launch, or for those with infinite money to pull every broken character that can literally one-shot you the moment you spawn.

I had fun in the lower leagues where you can at least try out the diverse One Piece cast, but the moment you (accidentally) climb to S- and above, the game becomes unbearable. Daily tasks like knocking out 3 enemies or capturing 3 flags turn into near impossibilities. You‚Äôre outclassed by whales and veterans, and there‚Äôs no way around it.

In hindsight, I should‚Äôve expected this ‚Äî a PvP gacha game will always be unfair.

As a huge One Piece fan with limited spending power, this game is nothing short of disappointing. 

[i]‚ÄúA Whale‚Äôs Playground, Not a Pirate‚Äôs Adventure‚Äù[/i]

As a long time One Piece fan and gacha game enjoyer, I would have to say that this game is blatantly one of the worst games I have ever played. The matchmaking decides that if you reach a certain point, all you will come up against are players 2 ranks higher than you, in pretty much every match. For such a wide character roster, only 95% of the characters aren't viable or are downright useless. It seems the only way to be competetive is to a) have been playing for years or b) spend way too much money trying to not only get the new "meta" character, but get dupes of them so you can have that character at max level. But I think the most egregious part of the game is that they keep coming up with characters that are so oppressive it just sucks the fun out of the game. Take Kizaru for example. As far as I know, he has:

1) An auto-dodge passive that avoids skills if he's at above a certain health threshold - no need to time your dodges.
2) A passive that heals him based on the damage he does, so if you got lucky to damage him in the first place, he just heals right back up.
3) A Map-wide damage skill that hits almost every single capture point. So any Defenders sitting on their points doing their job get obliterated, and Runners trying to capture flags are just straight up dead. So 1 character essentially invalidates 2 of the major roles of the game

Sure, you can counter this character with like, 1 or 2 units. But they have a 0.04% chance of being summoned on the banners they come up with.

And supposedly the game has a big hacker problem? I couldn't tell who was hacking or not, because I was trying to do objectives and getting blasted by Kizaru from across the map anyways.

While the start of the game is relatively generous and fun, and doing some of the character progression events is a nice dopamine hit, it quickly turns into a nightmare of constantly facing teams that have 70,000 combat power higher than you from other tiers, laggy servers, and broken characters that if you didn't summon them, you might as well take a break from the game for the season (or just quit). Absolutely one of the worst new player experiences I have ever had in a gacha game, that trades the good name of the One Piece series and turns it into a blatant cash-grab.

So if anyone ends up getting to the bottom of this review, just know the game is not worth your time or investment.

TL;DR: Game is not fun.

It breaks my heart to not recommend this game, but I'm left with no choice. I've waited so so long for Bounty Rush to hit Steam but there's far too many complications. When I first played it I couldn't even get passed a black screen. The servers are horrid. You can't load anything. Whenever there's updates, you can't even download said update. It stays stuck at 0% for lord knows how long before it tells you there was an error. You click okay only for it to be the same loop.

I've only managed to play one match. And that was a battle to just get to. But from playing that one battle, it was really fun. The game is visually beautiful, and has so much potential. But if you can't even load to the main menu there's zero point in playing. I straight up uninstalled and hope one day they fix whatever is going on. I promise you, it's not my internet. I have never had issues with my net. Only with this game.

That aside, it's also a huge let down that from what I noticed, there wasn't even a VS mode to fight against CPU's. You'd think they'd have something like that. Such a simple thing could make players keep playing over and over.
